message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SD, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating the relative difficulty of a pair of questions in community question answering services. It proposes a novel system called DiffQue that leverages network structure, metadata of users/posts, and textual description of questions and answers to predict the direction of a virtual edge connecting two questions in the network. This problem involves natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning techniques, which are commonly used in the sub-categories of computational linguistics (cs.CL), information retrieval (cs.IR), and machine learning (cs.LG). The use of network structure and metadata also suggests the involvement of social network analysis (cs.SI) and data mining (cs.SD) sub-categories.
